title: Topics in Chicano/a-Latino/a Cultures
description: Cross-disciplinary study of late twentieth-century Chicano/a-Latino/a literature, the visual and performing arts, film, or other cultural practices. Representative areas of study are social movements, revolution, immigration, globalization, gender and sexuality, cultures of the US-Mexican border, and Chicano/a-Mexicano/a literary relations. May be taken up to two times for credit as topics vary.  Prerequisites:  LTSP 100A or 100B, or consent of instructor.
